name: Graph.GraphViz
comment:
Exports a Graph in [GraphViz](http://www.graphviz.org) format.

@docs string

values.name: string
values.comment: A GraphViz representation of the Graph.

name: Graph

aliases.name: Graph
aliases.comment:
A network graph consists of a list of nodes connected by edges.

The node type of the Graph is abstract to allow you to use records extending the
type Node. Most functions provided by this work with `Graph Node`.
aliases.type: { edges : List Graph.Edge.Edge, nodes : List node }

values.name: empty
values.comment: Creates an empty graph without edges or nodes.

values.name: filter
values.comment: Filters a graph such that only nodes passing the test are included.

values.name: filterByName
values.comment:
Filter by name to include only nodes that start with the
specified name prefix.

values.name: init
values.comment: Initialize a node from a list of edges (see Edge) and nodes (see Node).
values.type: List Graph.Edge.Edge -> List Graph.Node.Node -> Graph.Graph Graph.Node.Node

name: Graph.Edge
comment:
An edge connects two nodes in a graph. Edges are designed to work with the
type Node. You may however use an extensible record to add fields to Node
without breaking the Edge implementation.

@docs Edge, filterForIdentifiers

aliases.name: Edge
aliases.comment: Describes the link between two nodes in a Graph.

values.name: filterForIdentifiers
values.comment:
Filter list of edges to only include edges referencing a node in the
given list. This is useful to exclude external nodes that might have been
accidentally referenced.
values.type: Set.Set Graph.Node.Identifier -> List Graph.Edge.Edge -> List Graph.Edge.Edge

name: Graph.Node

aliases.name: Identifier
aliases.comment: A simple type alias for String to make function signatures easier readable.

aliases.name: Name
aliases.comment:
A node's name is a list of strings to allow
you to represent paths (e.g. for modules).

aliases.name: Node
aliases.comment: Describes a node in a graph.

values.name: fromName
values.comment:
Create a node from a name using. An identifier will be created
automatically. Use this function if all nodes in your graph have unique names.

values.name: namePrefix
values.comment: Returns the first *n* members of a name.
